Articles.Content:
Hi Guys

It is that time of year again, the Winter (Summer) release window is coming in a couple of months and I was wondering what your most anticipated games for the coming season and beyond. Here's a my list

1. Civilization Beyond Earth (very excited for this one)

2. Galactic Civilizations 3

3. Kerbal Space Program (Updates)

On a bit of a side note, the developer of the Space Simulator IOS has started a kickstarter project that runs for about another month as off this post, don't know if any of you guys are interested in it.

Here is the Website: http://www.space-simulator.com/

Here is the Kickstarter Project: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1831895225/space-simulator-for-ios-and-android?ref=card
GTA V PC. I'm dying to fly a jet through buidlings!

Gal Civ 3

Witcher 3

Risen 3

and Starpoint Gemini 2

Yeaaa all sequels
Elite Dangerous... used to play the original on an Acorn Electron (yes that was a long time ago!)

I'm not even sure what games are due to be released. All I know is that I am usually disappointed by games when I am really looking forward to them. Watch_Dogs sounded like it was going to be an awesome game, but it was turd. I still play the original Monkey Island games and enjoy them.
The Division. Looks amazing and I hope that it will be occupied by more adults than whiny teens who have slept with my mother.
GTA V for PC, so I can waste my first year at the university LOL

KSP updates

Destiny

And although valve can't count to 3: Half Life 3
Ksp updates, advanced warfare, uncharted 4, space engine updates and elite dangerous

The game I'm currently looking forward to most is rise of the tomb raider. However I'm really sad that it will only be released for xbone at the beginning and that pc and playstation gamers have to wait. Other than that,

Dragon age inquisition

The division

GTA V pc
i haven't anticipated a game for a very long time.

Civilization: Beyond Earth

The Universim

KINGDOM HEARTS 3 EMAHARGD

KSP updates
Dragon Age: Inquisition and Witcher 3. I used to anticipate Half-Life 3 as well, but it's been so long since I played the previous games that I've forgotten what happens in them.

-Homeworld remastered(I never knew it existed before there were rumors but now this is at the top of my list)

-Star citizen.

-Civilisation BE.

-Master chief collection(Even If it'll only be through playthroughs, it's only eye candy anyway)

-Universim(ish)

-No mans sky.
Hotline Miami 2.

Fallout: Equestria - The Game. Heard it'd be open alpha in December...

Yeah yeah most of you don't like ponies.

Yeah yeah most of you don't like ponies.

Hey, it might not be my thing, but I honestly don't understand people's problem with it. (runs away, hopes that didn't start the great flame war)

Back on topic, if browser games count, Storium.

Gta 5 PC.

Gta 5 PC.

Gta 5 PC.

Gta 5 PC.

Gta 5 PC.

Gta 5 PC.

Gta 5 PC.

Gta 5 PC.

Gta 5 PC.Gta 5 PC.

Gta 5 PC.

Gta 5 PC.Gta 5 PC.

Gta 5 PC.

Gta 5 PC.

GTA V PC. I'm dying to fly a jet through buidlings!

There's a mod for that in GTA IV... But I share your impatience

There's a wealth of stunning games in the works at the moment

Of course Elite Dangerous, GTA 5 PC, The Witcher 3 but also lots of interesting indie titles

This looks sooo good!

Just the kind of game that fires my imagination

Before

and I can't wait for No Man's Sky
I am awkwardly excited for No Man's Sky. I feel like I have been waiting for that game my whole life.

I am awkwardly excited for No Man's Sky. I feel like I have been waiting for that game my whole life.

Yeah I know what you mean, the first video they released blew me away and I've been itching to get exploring that universe ever since.

Universe Sandbox 2 Alpha 13

Ratchet and Clank movie

Yeah I know what you mean, the first video they released blew me away and I've been itching to get exploring that universe ever since.

Remember how good Spore looked in the initial trailers?
star citizen, updates for ksp, and no mans sky.
